summary: First responders stopped on the side of the road risk being struck by passing vehicles. To protect these workers, all states and D.C. enacted "Move Over" laws that require motorists to move over to another lane or slow down when they pass a roadside incident. The Department of Transportation helps state officials educate the public about Move Over laws and administers funding that state officials...
title: Emergency Responder Safety: States and DOT Are Implementing Actions to Reduce Roadside Crashes
